title: news.com.au — Australia’s #1 news site
text: Labor frontbencher Kristina Keneally says “the government has accepted all the recommendations” from the bipartisan stillbirth inquiry report. A motion move is expected on Tuesday “with the support of Senator Lambie, other Labor senators, the Greens, and the government to recognise Pregnancy and Infant Loss Remembrance Day”. The health minister will launch a 'safer baby bundle' at parliament, with aims to reduce the chance of late-term stillbirths by 20 per cent over the next three years. Ms Keneally told Sky News she wants the initiative “to recognise the six families every day in Australia who lose a baby to stillbirth”. Image: News Corp Australia
